newsitem.title: USA: Soros group holds 5.15 pct Sybase stake.
newsitem.headline: Soros group holds 5.15 pct Sybase stake.

text.p: A group led by international financier George Soros said Monday it has acquired a 5.15 percent stake Sybase Inc, a database software and application development tools company.
In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, the group said it paid $23.33 million for the stake and holds it for investment purposes.

According to the filing, Soros holds 2,176,400 shares or 2.85 percent of Sybase's common stock outstanding. Of this, Soros holds 1.8 million shars for his own account while Quantum Partners and Quantum Industrial Partnres LDC, two funds managed by the financier's Soros Fund Management, hold 376,400 shares.

Purnendu Chatterjee, a New York-based investment manager who acts as Soros' partner in several investments, holds 1,758,800 shares or 2.3 percent of the outstanding. He holds the shares through Winson LDC and Winston LLC, funds under his management.
The group holds the stake in the Emeryville, California-based company for investment purposes, according to the filing.
